label: 辯才天
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Benzaiten (辯才天), also referred to as  Dai Benzaiten(nyo) 大辯才天（女）, Daishō Benzaitenshin 大聖弁才天神, Benten 弁天, Myoonten妙音天, Mionten 美音天, Sarasabatei 薩羅薩伐底, Benzaiten 辨財天 (alternate characters), Dai Ben-kudokuten 大辯功徳天. Deity, of Indian origin (Sk. Sarasvatī), who is the goddess of learning, the arts, and oral eloquence. In Japan, Benzaiten constitutes one of the 7 deities of good fortune.  Her image housed in Tōdaiji  in the 8th century and in shrines at Itsukushima, Chikubujima, and Enoshima since the medieval era, Benzaiten was the object of esoteric Buddhist rites by at least the 12 century.
